citation.article-title: Chryseobacterium bovis sp. nov., isolated from raw cow's milk.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Chryseobacterium bovis sp. nov.
Chryseobacterium bovis (bo′vis. L. gen. n. bovis of a cow, referring to the isolation from raw cow's milk).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile rods, 0.5–0.9 μm wide and 1.1–2.3 μm long.
After 48 h incubation on sterile SPC agar at 30 °C in the dark, colonies are circular with entire edges, opaque, smooth and cream-coloured.
When light is provided during growth, colonies are yellow-coloured because of the production of carotenoid-type pigments (absorbance peaks at 454 and 481 nm).
Weakly positive in the KOH test, indicating the presence of small amounts of flexirubin-type pigments.
Good growth occurs under aerobic conditions.
Growth is also observed after 5 days under anaerobic conditions on SPC agar containing 0.1 % (w/v) potassium nitrate, but not on SPC agar with 0.5 % glucose.
Grows at 7–37 °C (strain H10 grows at temperatures up to 41 °C) (optimum, 30–32 °C), with 0–2.5 % NaCl (optimum, 0–1.75 % NaCl) and at pH 5.0–9.8 (optimum, pH 6.5–8.5).
Good growth occurs on SPC and tryptic soy agars, but not on MacConkey or cetrimide agar.
No haemolysis occurs on 5 % sheep-blood agar.
Catalase and oxidase activities are present.
Casein (except for strain H10) and tributyrin are hydrolysed.

In API 20NE tests after 48 h incubation at 32 °C, all three strains hydrolyse aesculin and assimilate glucose, mannose and maltose, but only H9T and H15 assimilate arabinose, mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, gluconate and adipic and malic acids.

The following results are obtained from API 20E strips after 24 h incubation at 32 °C: acetoin is produced; β-galactosidase activity is present (except for strain H10); gelatin is hydrolysed (except for strain H10); H2S and indole are not produced; urea is not hydrolysed; citrate is not utilized; and arginine dihydrolase, lysine and ornithine decarboxylases and tryptophan deaminase activities are absent.
In API 50 CH strips incubated for 48 h at 32 °C, acid is produced from d-glucose, maltose, d-lactose and d-mannose (except for strain H10).

In API ZYM strips incubated for 4.5 h, alkaline and acid phosphatases, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-glucosidase activities are present in all the three strains.
Cystine arylamidase and β-galactosidase activities are present in strains H9T and H15 and trypsin activity is present only in strain H10.
The predominant cellular fatty acids of the type strain are 15 : 0 iso (38.9 %), 15 : 0 anteiso (15.6 %) and 17 : 0 iso 3-OH (12.7 %).

The following fatty acids are present as minor components: summed feature 3 (comprising 15 : 0 iso 2-OH and/or 16 : 1ω7c; 8.7 %), 13 : 0 iso (4.8 %), 16 : 0 3-OH (3.9 %), 15 : 0 iso 3-OH (2.6 %), 17 : 1 iso ω9c (2.5 %), 16 : 0 (2.1 %), unknown 16.582 (1.7 %), 16 : 0 iso 3-OH (1.6 %) and 17 : 0-2-OH (1.3 %).
Traces (<1 %) of 13 : 0 anteiso, 14 : 0, 14 : 0 iso, 15 : 0, 15 : 0 2-OH and 18 : 1ω5c are also present.
In strain H10, 17 : 1 iso ω9c is also a major fatty acid (14.8 %).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 38.6 mol%.
The type strain, H9T (=LMG 24227T =DSM 19482T), was isolated from raw milk in Israel.
Strains H15 (=LMG 24229 =DSM 19481) and H10 (=LMG 24228 =DSM 19483) are reference strains.
